subject: Programming
title: The Halting Problem
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Halting Problem.

hook.text: Can a program determine whether any other program will finish or loop forever?

buildup.text: Alan Turing posed this question in 1936 and proved the answer is no.

discovery.text: He showed that any halting detector would contradict itself when given its own code as input.

twist.text: This means some questions about programs are mathematically unanswerable by any computer.

climax.text: The halting problem set the boundary of computation. Some things are provably unsolvable.

punchline.text: Not every question has a computable answer.

quiz.question: Who proved the halting problem is unsolvable?
